name: checkov
description: Find and fix misconfigurations in infrastructure-as-code manifests like Terraform, Kubernetes, Cloudformation, Serverless framework, Arm templates using Checkov - static analysis for infrastructure as code .

checkov.token.title: Token
checkov.token.markdownDescription:
In order to activate inline infrastructure-as-code fixes, you need to integrate with Bridgecrew's fixes API.   
 It's free to create an account and takes less than 2 minutes, Go to [Bridgecrew Platform](https://bridgecrew.cloud/) to get started.  
 Your API token can be found in the integrations tab, under "API Token".   
  For Prisma Cloud users - use your access keys as token in the following format: `"<AccessKey>::<SecretKey>"`.  
 The extension will provide API access to the file, if checkov finds policy violations, in order to generate and supply the suggested fixes.

checkov.certificate.title: Path to CA Certificate file
checkov.certificate.markdownDescription: [Optional] You can use a custom CA-Certificate, set the path to it here.

checkov.useBridgecrewIDs.title: Use Bridgecrew platform IDs
checkov.useBridgecrewIDs.markdownDescription: Whether to use Bridgecrew platform IDs (BC_...) instead of Checkov IDs (CKV_...)

checkov.checkovVersion.title: Checkov version
checkov.checkovVersion.markdownDescription: The Checkov scanner version to use (e.g., 2.0.123). Enter 'latest' or leave blank to always use the latest version. Enter 'platform' to use the version currently used by the Bridgecrew / Prisma platform. Be sure to run the 'Install or Update Checkov' command after changing this value. Use the 'About Checkov' command to view the current version.

checkov.disableErrorMessage.title: Disable error message
checkov.disableErrorMessage.markdownDescription: Stop showing error message popups (use the 'Open Checkov Log' command to view the log).

checkov.prismaURL.title: Prisma app URL
checkov.prismaURL.markdownDescription:
URL of your Prisma Cloud application API. (e.g., https://api.prismacloud.io)    
 [Required] if you are using Prisma Cloud access key

checkov.useDebugLogs.title: Use debug logs
checkov.useDebugLogs.markdownDescription: Whether to print debug logs from Checkov for troubleshooting

checkov.externalChecksDir.title: External Checks Directory
checkov.externalChecksDir.markdownDescription: Path to external checks to be added

checkov.noCertVerify.title: Skip SSL cert verification
checkov.noCertVerify.markdownDescription: Skip SSL certificate verification. Use this to bypass errors related to SSL certificates. Warning: this should only be used for testing purposes. Skipping certificate verification is dangerous as invalid and falsified certificates cannot be detected.

checkov.skipFrameworks.title: Skip Frameworks
checkov.skipFrameworks.markdownDescription:
Comma-separated list of frameworks to skip (e.g., 'arm, json, secrets, serverless'). 
 This is useful if you do not need to scan or do not have the required license for a specific framework. 
 See [Checkov Frameworks](https://www.checkov.io/2.Basics/CLI%20Command%20Reference.html) for more information.

checkov.frameworks.title: Frameworks
checkov.frameworks.markdownDescription:
Comma-separated list of frameworks to scan (e.g., 'arm, json, secrets, serverless'). 
 This is useful if you only want to scan specific frameworks. 
 See [Checkov Frameworks](https://www.checkov.io/2.Basics/CLI%20Command%20Reference.html) for more information.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
